pull.title: Bugfix: When restoring table columns, still set their minimum column width and stretch on last section
pull.body:
~~Regression introduced in #205~~

Correction: Undefined behaviour currently makes this a non-issue, but probably better to be safe and do it correctly.

events.message: Bugfix: GUI: When restoring table columns, still set their minimum column width and stretch on last section

rename.from: Bugfix: GUI: When restoring table columns, still set their minimum column width and stretch on last section
rename.to: Bugfix: When restoring table columns, still set their minimum column width and stretch on last section

events.body:
> When restoring table columns, still set their minimum column width and stretch on last section

Are `minimumSectionSize` and `stretchLastSection` parts of the saved state?

> Regression introduced in #205

How is it observable by a user?

> Are minimumSectionSize and stretchLastSection parts of the saved state?

yes, they both are. See: https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qt.git/tree/src/gui/itemviews/qheaderview.cpp#n3556
- [minimumSectionSize](https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qt.git/tree/src/gui/itemviews/qheaderview.cpp#n3579)
- [stretchLastSection](https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qt.git/tree/src/gui/itemviews/qheaderview.cpp#n3574)

> Regression introduced in #205

While I think this change is ok, is it possible for a user to actually manipulate the header view in a way where they can run into an issue here?

@luke-jr 

The [`minimumSectionSize`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qheaderview.html#minimumSectionSize-prop) and [`stretchLastSection`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qheaderview.html#stretchLastSection-prop) properties of the [`QHeaderView`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qheaderview.html) class are saved with [`QHeaderView::saveState`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qheaderview.html#saveState) and restored with [`QHeaderView::restoreState`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qheaderview.html#restoreState).

> Regression introduced in #205

1. From the PR description it is not clear what is actually a bug in the current master branch. Could you elaborate please?

2. What is the reason to set `minimumSectionSize` and `stretchLastSection` _before_ restoring the header state, when during this restoring (if it succeeds, of course) the values of these properties will be overwritten?

I guess this is more about not relying on undefined behaviour rather than a bugfix.

Leaving the assignment prior to restoring sizes, so that users who actually go to the trouble to hack their setting are respected.

> I guess this is more about not relying on undefined behaviour rather than a bugfix.
> 
> Leaving the assignment prior to restoring sizes, so that users who actually go to the trouble to hack their setting are respected.

Why only are `setMinimumSectionSize` and `setStretchLastSection` considered? And not `setColumnWidth` methods?

And `-resetguisettings` could always help :)

This discussion has been inactive for a long time.

Should it be closed?

Let's leave this open - In previous work I added a "bumper" column to the tableview - this helped address some of the issues. The bumper column was an addon to other PRs but not a stand alone PR - I will put together a PR that focuses on why this is useful.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#684](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/684) (Improve 'Requested Payments History' Multiselect by john-moffett)
* [#662](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/662) (Fix transaction view/table by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

@luke-jr 

> This discussion has been inactive for a long time.
> 
> Should it be closed?

Instead of reacting with the "thumbs down" emoji, maybe just answer questions from the [comments](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/368#issuecomment-916192090)?
